body.p: A researcher conducted a survey of graduating college students. 350 college students were randomly selected to answer the survey. One of the survey questions asked, “What are your plans after graduation?” 214 students said they were planning to find a job, 83 students said they were planning to attend graduate school, and 53 students did not reply to the question.
What is the point estimate for the proportion of all college students who plan to find a job after graduation?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the number of sampled college students who plan to find a job after graduation. You need to find the sample proportion based on the sample size of 350.
Incorrect. This is the number of sampled college students who plan to attend graduate school. You need to find the sample proportion who plan to find a job based on the sample size of 350.
Correct. The sample proportion who plan to find a job is 214/350 = 0.61. This is the point estimator for the proportion of all college students who plan to find a job after graduation.

Incorrect. It appears you found the proportion of students who said they were planning to attend graduate school (83/350 = 0.24). You need to find the sample proportion who plan to find a job based on the sample size of 350.

body.p: A researcher conducted a survey of graduating college students. 350 college students were randomly selected to answer the survey. One of the survey questions asked, “How much do you owe in student loans?” The average student loan debt reported by respondents was $42,576 with a standard deviation of $2,801.
$42,576 is the point estimate for which of the following?

input.choice: The proportion of all college students who graduate college in debt.
The mean salary of all college students who graduate college.
The mean loan debt of all college students who graduate college.
The standard deviation of loan debt of all college students who graduate college.

response.feedback: Incorrect. $42,576 is not a proportion (it is not a value between 0 and 1), thus it cannot be the point estimate for the proportion of all college students who graduate college in debt.
Incorrect. Students were asked to report their loan debt, thus it cannot be a point estimate for the mean salary of all students who graduate college.
Correct. $42,576 is the sample mean loan debt. This is the point estimate of the population mean loan debt for all students who graduate college.
Incorrect. $42,576 is a sample mean, thus it cannot be the point estimate for the standard deviation of loan debt for all students who graduate college.
